randoop.generation

Class GrtFuzzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • randoop.generation.GrtFuzzer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GrtNumericFuzzer, GrtStringFuzzer

    public abstract class GrtFuzzer
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract strategy for "impurity fuzzing" as described in GRT: Program-Analysis-Guided Random Testing (ASE 2015) (Ma et al., ASE 2015):

    fuzz(randoop.sequence.Sequence) receives a Sequence and fuzzes its last variable's value in order to explore additional program states and improve branch coverage. A concrete fuzzer may append extra Statements, return an unchanged sequence (if the type is unsupported or uninteresting).

      • fuzz

        public abstract Sequence fuzz(Sequence sequence)
        Appends fuzzing statements to sequence. If the type is unsupported by this fuzzer, the implementation throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence whose last value will be fuzzed
        Returns:
        a new sequence with additional fuzzing statements, or the original sequence if no fuzzing was performed
